Women in America deserve no less than a guarantee that the freedoms bestowed by the Constitution apply equally to all—regardless of gender. We're working for Congress to strike the arbitrary deadline on the Equal Rights Amendment and ratify the 28th amendment to the Constitution.

We come together to remember the six million Jewish victims and other victims of the Holocaust.

We must preserve their memory and never forget.

As we mark its 49th anniversary today, we’re facing the greatest threats to Roe v Wade we’ve seen in a generation.

A woman’s right to choose is a fundamental right.

And this Senate will vote on the Women’s Health Protection Act to protect abortion rights.

We are devastated at the tragic news that two NYPD officers have been shot while protecting the community, one who was killed and one who is seriously wounded. Our prayers are with them, their families, and all who loved them.

Senate Democrats’ fight for voting rights is not over.

We will keep fighting until voting rights are protected for every single American.

The examples of MLK, of John Lewis give us strength and show us sometimes the only right option is to move forward

With Trump
his Big Lie
Jan. 6
voter suppression
dark money interests fueling today's GOP

This is a fight for the soul of America

And we will not shy away from it

The march for democracy is never over. And we have to and we will keep marching.

Senate Democrats will continue our fight against voter suppression, dark money, and partisan gerrymandering.

We will keep moving forward for our democracy.

Senate Democrats won't be deterred

With no support from the Senate GOP—many denying voter suppression even exists—we faced an uphill battle in this vote

But every Senator's now on record

Americans see who’s for voting rights

It only strengthens our resolve to protect voting

Inaction is not an option on voting rights

Because Republicans blocked these bills that protect the right to vote:

We’re going to vote on changing Senate rules for these bills

The Senate must choose in favor of our democracy

The Senate must stand up and defend voting rights

The Big Lie has paved the way for a naked attempt by partisan legislators to re-write the rules of our elections to make it harder to vote

Our voting rights bills can put a stop to it NOW

But if the GOP blocks this vote—we must change the rules of the Senate to pass these bills

The work of justice does not stir into action on its own.

We must assure our country does not backslide here in the 21st century.

We will take a stand and do everything we can to protect voting rights today.

It's Sen. McConnell’s Big Lie: That states aren't trying to suppress the vote

The truth: 19 states passed 33 new laws making it harder to vote—for people of color, poor people, young people, disabled people

We will keep moving forward on our legislation to protect our democracy https://t.co/mFaVzAdWxH

I so was proud to recommend Nusrat Choudhury to @POTUS to serve as a federal judge for NY’s Eastern District, and he just nominated her!

She's an ACLU Legal Director

She'd be the 1st Bangladeshi American & 2nd Muslim American to serve as a federal judge

https://t.co/HQ2WV9JVV8

Following my request with @NydiaVelazquez, the Biden Administration has selected Caño Martín Peña in Puerto Rico to receive infrastructure law funding.

We've secured a historic $163M to restore the Caño and fully rectify this environmental and social injustice.

The GOP shouldn't be allowed to sit in their offices and block voting rights

Dr. King had simple, powerful advice for his followers during moments like this:

Keep moving. Keep fighting. The road to justice is often painful and full of setback, but we must keep moving.

We'll keep fighting to protect our democracy, and we'll keep fighting until we win.

The Senate is now officially debating the Freedom to Vote & John Lewis Voting Rights Advancement Acts on the floor

Senators were elected to debate and vote—especially on issues like voting rights

This is a step forward to put everyone on record

We'll keep fighting until we win

Yesterday’s alarming hostage trauma at Congregation Beth Israel in Texas is a stark reminder of the danger of antisemitism and why we must continue to increase our investment in non-profit security grants for groups who are targets of hate.

The infrastructure bill we passed will deliver over $1.8 billion to fix hundreds of bridges across New York.

It will deliver a historic amount of funding to states to fix bridges nationwide.

It will improve safety, grow the economy, and create jobs across NY and the country.

With the infrastructure bill we passed:
 
More than $27 billion will go to states and tribal governments to fix approximately 15,000 bridges nationwide.
 
This historic investment in our bridges will improve safety, grow the economy, and create jobs across the country. https://t.co/s0W3OQPb07

Harry Reid of Searchlight, Nevada

All of us in the Senate must make a choice about how we will do our part to preserve our democracy.

We can’t be satisfied in thinking democracy will win in the end if we aren't willing to put in the work to defend it.

We must act to protect democracy, and we will move forward.

Sen. McConnell's attempts to misdirect from the dangers of Trump’s Big Lie?

They're 𝒈𝒂𝒔𝒍𝒊𝒈𝒉𝒕𝒊𝒏𝒈

The truth is he can't defend laws making it harder for primarily younger, poorer, or non-white voters to access the ballot

If Senate Republicans continue to hijack the rules of the Senate to prevent us from protecting the right to vote:

Senate Democrats will move forward as soon as tomorrow to restore the function of the Senate and pass legislation to defend democracy and protect voting rights.

What I said today on @TheView:

Since the 2020 election, GOP legislatures led by Trump’s Big Lie have passed laws making it harder for people to vote

We will act to protect voting https://t.co/mIvwdmyphO

Today, President Biden is heading to Georgia to make the case for the Senate to pass voting rights legislation.

And as soon as tomorrow, the Senate will move forward to protect democracy and voting rights.

In a democracy when you lose in an election, you’re supposed to figure out why and try to win over the voters you lost.

You don't try to stop them from voting!

That’s what happens in autocracies.

We will act to protect our democracy.

I borrowed your chart, @JohnCornyn, because it doesn’t say what you want it to

The chart's fine—2020's election was free, fair, accurate

Since then GOP legislatures—led by Trump's Big Lie—have made it harder to vote. Just ask Harris County.

We will move ahead to protect voting https://t.co/yCelF2qkr7

By blocking action on voting rights, Senate Republicans are saying they are perfectly fine with laws that restrict how younger, poorer, and non-white Americans typically vote.

These laws are Jim Crow 2.0.

The Senate will act to support our democracy and protect voting rights.

The 2020 election was free, fair, and accurate.

But out of Trump’s Big Lie, GOP legislatures across the country have passed laws making it harder to vote, harder to register to vote, and more.

The Senate will act to protect our democracy and voting rights.

Tough as nails
A fighter
But also one of the most compassionate individuals

He never forgot where he came from, always stuck up for the underdog
